title: replies that the increasing nature of the soul explains why logos is so deep and consequently how the “human intellect has an inexhaustible capacity to extend the range of its understanding.” Along similar lines Kahn

Roussos and the Index Fontium point out as an allusion to fr. 115 also III.6.1.31, but nothing in the Plotinian text justifies this reference
For both interpretations cf
For Heraclitus’ fr. 60 in Plotinus cf
